hitagifs.commands — Commands¶

All the functions in this module are scripts to be called from the command line.

Usage: hfs command args ...

hitagifs.commands.tag(fs, *args)¶

Usage: hfs tag tag file1 [file2, [...]]

Tags file with tag (Hard links file under tag directory with the same name). If file is already tagged, does nothing. If file is a directory, you’ll need to convert it first.

hitagifs.commands.untag(fs, *args)¶

Usage: hfs untag tag file1 [file2, [...]]

Removes tag tag from file (Removes the hard link to file under tag directory). If file isn’t tagged, does nothing.

hitagifs.commands.tags(fs, *args)¶

Usage: hfs tags file

Lists all the tags of file (Lists the directories that have hard links to file).

hitagifs.commands.find(fs, *args)¶

Usage: hfs find tag1 [tag2 [...]]

Intersect tag search. Lists all files that have all of the given tags. Lists files by the path to the hard link under the first tag given.

hitagifs.commands.rm(fs, *args)¶

Usage: hfs rm file1 [file2 [...]]

Removes the files given (Removes all hard links to the files under the root directory).

hitagifs.commands.rename(fs, *args)¶

Usage: hfs rename file new

Renames all hard links to file to new.

hitagifs.commands.convert(fs, *args)¶

Usage: hfs convert dir1 [dir2 [...]]

Converts directories so they can be tagged. (Moves directories to special location ‘.hitagifs/dirs’ and replaces the original with a symlink pointing to the absolute path)

hitagifs.commands.init(*args)¶

Usage: hfs convert [dir]

Creates a hitagifs in dir (for internal tracking purposes). If dir is omitted, creates a hitagifs in the current directory.
